note: 'Primary energyâ€™ refers to energy in its raw form, before conversion into electricity, heat or transport fuels. It is here measured in terms of 'input equivalents' via the substitution method: the amount of primary energy that would be required from fossil fuels to generate the same amount of electricity from solar.
title: Primary energy consumption from solar and wind
subtitle: Energy consumption is based on primary energy equivalents, rather than final electricity use.
